Typically, we define "X is Y's ancestor" meaning X -> Y (X is ancestor, Y is descendant). "X is Y's descendant" meaning X is descendant of Y, i.e., Y is ancestor of X, so edge Y -> X.

Thus we have a directed graph where an edge A -> B indicates A is an ancestor of B (B is descendant of A). So "X is Y's ancestor" => edge X -> Y. "X is Y's descendant" => edge Y -> X.
